I think the first time David Letterman said he was going to leave in two years was back in 1987.... It was kind of a tossed-off response. I think it's a response he's given multiple times.... In no way was last night's show any kind of actual announcement of any kind. I think when a guy ends a 30-plus career on television, it's not going to be guessing about whether he's leaving or not. It won't be ambiguous. Watch Howard Stern call Jay Leno "horrible" on David Letterman appearance( David Letterman 's "two years" quote is not part of the clip) Is David Letterman retiring? Eric Schmidt , who has headed up Google since July 2001, sent a message via Twitter Thursday saying: Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on new products and projects. In February, Google acquired Clifton Park, N.Y.-based video-compression company for about$ 124.6 million.
